physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal visual acuity and ocular tension; however, slightly elevated ocular tension at 19 torr bilaterally noted in 1998; discrete bilateral nasal step in 2002; binasal hemianopia in 2006, with normal visual acuity and ocular tension.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive visual deficits were noted over time, with stable ocular tension until 2006, when binasal hemianopia was observed. Postoperative follow-up revealed normal visual fields 4 months after surgery.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Improvement in visual field deficits within the first 48 hours post-surgery.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive improvement of visual field deficits following microvascular decompression.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal visual fields according to Humphrey testing, normal macula and optic disks, stable visual acuity and ocular tension.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement from binasal hemianopia to normal visual fields, demonstrating significant recovery post-surgery.
